trans-unit.source: Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services
trans-unit.target: Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services

trans-unit.source: The Partners page displays the list of partners with their name, email, phone, and description.
trans-unit.target: The Partners page displays the list of partners with their name, email, phone, and description.

trans-unit.source: Using this page, you can add or delete partners and their profiles.
trans-unit.target: Using this page, you can add or delete partners and their profiles.

trans-unit.source: It is important to understand the concept of a <legacyBold>Service Provider</legacyBold> and a <legacyBold>Partner</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: It is important to understand the concept of a <legacyBold>Service Provider</legacyBold> and a <legacyBold>Partner</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Service Provider </legacyBold> is you or your company.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Service Provider </legacyBold> is you or your company.

trans-unit.source: A <legacyBold>Partner</legacyBold> is whomever you receive or send EDI files, which can include another company, another department within your company, and so on.
trans-unit.target: A <legacyBold>Partner</legacyBold> is whomever you receive or send EDI files, which can include another company, another department within your company, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Pipelines are deployed for the <legacyBold>Hosted Partner</legacyBold> when the agreement is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Pipelines are deployed for the <legacyBold>Hosted Partner</legacyBold> when the agreement is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Receive and Send settings are oriented to the context of the <legacyBold>Hosted Partner</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Receive and Send settings are oriented to the context of the <legacyBold>Hosted Partner</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: For example, the receive settings in an agreement determine how the <legacyBold>Hosted Partner</legacyBold> receives messages sent from a <legacyBold>Guest Partner</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: For example, the receive settings in an agreement determine how the <legacyBold>Hosted Partner</legacyBold> receives messages sent from a <legacyBold>Guest Partner</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, the send settings on the agreement indicate how the <legacyBold>Hosted Partner</legacyBold> sends messages to the <legacyBold>Guest Partner</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, the send settings on the agreement indicate how the <legacyBold>Hosted Partner</legacyBold> sends messages to the <legacyBold>Guest Partner</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: In this topic:
trans-unit.target: In this topic:

trans-unit.source: Add a new partner
trans-unit.target: Add a new partner

trans-unit.source: After you register yourself as the service provider, you can add or delete trading partners in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: After you register yourself as the service provider, you can add or delete trading partners in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Partners</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Partners</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In Partners, click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In Partners, click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>New Partner</ui>, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: In <ui>New Partner</ui>, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: Partner name
trans-unit.target: Partner name

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the partner.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the partner.

trans-unit.source: The name must be unique.
trans-unit.target: The name must be unique.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enter a note or description for the partner.
trans-unit.target: Enter a note or description for the partner.

trans-unit.source: First name
trans-unit.target: First name

trans-unit.source: Enter the first name of the primary contact in the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the first name of the primary contact in the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Last name
trans-unit.target: Last name

trans-unit.source: Enter the last name of the primary contact in the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the last name of the primary contact in the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Email ID
trans-unit.target: Email ID

trans-unit.source: Enter the email ID of the primary contact in the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the email ID of the primary contact in the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Phone
trans-unit.target: Phone

trans-unit.source: Enter the phone number of the primary contact in the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the phone number of the primary contact in the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Website URL
trans-unit.target: Website URL

trans-unit.source: Enter the website of the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the website of the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Country
trans-unit.target: Country

trans-unit.source: Enter the country/region of the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the country/region of the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Address (Line1)
trans-unit.target: Address (Line1)

trans-unit.source: Enter the address of the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the address of the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Address (Line2)
trans-unit.target: Address (Line2)

trans-unit.source: Enter any additional address information of the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter any additional address information of the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: City
trans-unit.target: City

trans-unit.source: Enter the city of the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the city of the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: State
trans-unit.target: State

trans-unit.source: Enter the state of the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the state of the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Postal Code
trans-unit.target: Postal Code

trans-unit.source: Enter the postal zip code of the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the postal zip code of the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui> to add the partner.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui> to add the partner.

trans-unit.source: When the partners are added, profiles are created automatically.
trans-unit.target: When the partners are added, profiles are created automatically.

trans-unit.source: When you add you or your company as a Service Provider, you are not automatically added as a Partner.
trans-unit.target: When you add you or your company as a Service Provider, you are not automatically added as a Partner.

trans-unit.source: This feature allows you to add multiple partners as the Hosted Partner or Guest Partner, including creating agreements between multiple partners.
trans-unit.target: This feature allows you to add multiple partners as the Hosted Partner or Guest Partner, including creating agreements between multiple partners.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>To Delete a Partner</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>To Delete a Partner</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: Select the row listing the partner that you want to delete and then select <embeddedLabel>Delete</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select the row listing the partner that you want to delete and then select <embeddedLabel>Delete</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You cannot delete a partner unless all the profiles and all the agreements for that partner are deleted.
trans-unit.target: You cannot delete a partner unless all the profiles and all the agreements for that partner are deleted.

trans-unit.source: Add or Edit a profile for a partner
trans-unit.target: Add or Edit a profile for a partner

trans-unit.source: Profiles are organization-specific settings that can correspond to organizational divisions.
trans-unit.target: Profiles are organization-specific settings that can correspond to organizational divisions.

trans-unit.source: For example, a partner retail organization named Contoso has an “Electronics” division that accepts orders for electronics inventory.
trans-unit.target: For example, a partner retail organization named Contoso has an “Electronics” division that accepts orders for electronics inventory.

trans-unit.source: This Electronics division submits requests for electronics supplies to a partner.
trans-unit.target: This Electronics division submits requests for electronics supplies to a partner.

trans-unit.source: Contoso also has an “Apparel” division that accepts orders for clothing and then submits requests for clothing supplies to a partner.
trans-unit.target: Contoso also has an “Apparel” division that accepts orders for clothing and then submits requests for clothing supplies to a partner.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, two profiles for the Contoso partner organization are created: “Contoso Electronics” and “Contoso Apparel”.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, two profiles for the Contoso partner organization are created: “Contoso Electronics” and “Contoso Apparel”.

trans-unit.source: A default profile is always created when a partner is added.
trans-unit.target: A default profile is always created when a partner is added.

trans-unit.source: Profiles can be changed.
trans-unit.target: Profiles can be changed.

trans-unit.source: On the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Partners</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Partners</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click on the partner name to open the <ui>Profiles</ui> page for the partner.
trans-unit.target: Click on the partner name to open the <ui>Profiles</ui> page for the partner.

trans-unit.source: To return to the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click the back button in the upper left corner.
trans-unit.target: To return to the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click the back button in the upper left corner.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Add</ui> to create a new profile, or click the existing profile.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Add</ui> to create a new profile, or click the existing profile.

trans-unit.source: In the <legacyBold>new profile</legacyBold> page, enter the follow information:
trans-unit.target: In the <legacyBold>new profile</legacyBold> page, enter the follow information:

trans-unit.source: Profile Name
trans-unit.target: Profile Name

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the profile.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the profile.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Enter information that describes this particular profile, like “Contoso Electronics”.
trans-unit.target: Enter information that describes this particular profile, like “Contoso Electronics”.

trans-unit.source: Identities
trans-unit.target: Identities

trans-unit.source: Add any identity qualifier values to be used with this profile by clicking <ui>+</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Add any identity qualifier values to be used with this profile by clicking <ui>+</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Choose a qualifier code from the drop down list and enter the value.
trans-unit.target: Choose a qualifier code from the drop down list and enter the value.

trans-unit.source: Certificates
trans-unit.target: Certificates

trans-unit.source: A certificate can be added <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> a profile is created and saved.
trans-unit.target: A certificate can be added <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> a profile is created and saved.

trans-unit.source: Certificates in the profile can be used for digital signatures with AS2.
trans-unit.target: Certificates in the profile can be used for digital signatures with AS2.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: When the Partner and Profile are complete, an Agreement can be created.
trans-unit.target: When the Partner and Profile are complete, an Agreement can be created.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="df2ee20f-a063-42f8-b9d1-ea6c3abdbfed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Agreements</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="df2ee20f-a063-42f8-b9d1-ea6c3abdbfed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Agreements</link>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>To Delete a Profile</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>To Delete a Profile</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: Select the partner that has the profile you want to delete.
trans-unit.target: Select the partner that has the profile you want to delete.

trans-unit.source: Then select the row listing the profile, and then select <embeddedLabel>Delete</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Then select the row listing the profile, and then select <embeddedLabel>Delete</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Add a certificate
trans-unit.target: Add a certificate

trans-unit.source: Once a profile is saved, you can add a certificate to that profile.
trans-unit.target: Once a profile is saved, you can add a certificate to that profile.

trans-unit.source: Certificates in a partner’s profile are used for message signing and encryption/decryption.
trans-unit.target: Certificates in a partner’s profile are used for message signing and encryption/decryption.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Partners</ui>, click the Partner name, and then click the profile.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Partners</ui>, click the Partner name, and then click the profile.

trans-unit.source: In the Certificates section, click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the Certificates section, click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Browse</ui> to the location of the certificate file.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Browse</ui> to the location of the certificate file.

trans-unit.source: A trading partner’s public certificate (<legacyItalic>CertificateName</legacyItalic>.cer) or your own private certificate (<legacyItalic>CertificateName</legacyItalic>.pfx) can be used.
trans-unit.target: A trading partner’s public certificate (<legacyItalic>CertificateName</legacyItalic>.cer) or your own private certificate (<legacyItalic>CertificateName</legacyItalic>.pfx) can be used.

trans-unit.source: Private certificates (.pfx) are password protected.
trans-unit.target: Private certificates (.pfx) are password protected.

trans-unit.source: If you are adding a private certificate (.pfx), enter the <ui>Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If you are adding a private certificate (.pfx), enter the <ui>Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To see the added certificates, select <ui>Resources</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, and then select <ui>Certificates</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To see the added certificates, select <ui>Resources</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, and then select <ui>Certificates</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <token>tpm_portal</token> also provides notifications for expired certificates.
trans-unit.target: The <token>tpm_portal</token> also provides notifications for expired certificates.

trans-unit.source: For information on importing certificates on the computer, see <link xlink:href="c3b8d534-fc79-4203-8f09-cd3ac3510675" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Importing certificates</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on importing certificates on the computer, see <link xlink:href="c3b8d534-fc79-4203-8f09-cd3ac3510675" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Importing certificates</link>.
